Math.Equation

Class Equation

  • java.lang.Object
    • Math.Equation.Equation

  • public class Equation
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that models an equation, and its behaviour.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.lang.String equation
      The raw equation.
      Factors factors
      The list of factors for this equation.

    • Field Detail

      • equation

        public java.lang.String equation
        The raw equation.

      • node

        public Node node
        The Node representing the whole equation.
        See Also:
        Node.generateNodes(ArrayList)

      • factors

        public Factors factors
        The list of factors for this equation. This includes what values variables are, and where to find what functions do.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Equation

        public Equation()
        The default constructor for the Equation class. Just passes an empty String, Node, and Factors to the main equation constructor.

      • Equation

        public Equation(java.lang.String pEq)
        The String-only constructor for the equation class. Just passes a Node created based off pEq, and an empty Factors class to the main equation constructor.
        Parameters:
        pEq - A String containing the equation that this class will be modeled after.

      • Equation

        public Equation(java.lang.String pEq,
                Factors pFactors)
        The String and Factors constructor for the equation class. Just passes a Node created based off pEq, and pFactors to the main equation constructor.
        Parameters:
        pEq - The String representation of the equation. Is only ever used to identify individual equations.
        pFactors - The Factors instance for the equation.

      • Equation

        public Equation(Node pN)
        The Node-only for the equation class. Just passes a String created based on Node's subnodes, and an empty Factors class to the main equation constructor.
        Parameters:
        pN - The Node that the equation class will be modeled after.

      • Equation

        public Equation(java.lang.String pEq,
                Node pN,
                Factors pFactors)
        The main constructor for the equation class. Takes the parameter pEq, and parses the tokens from it, and generates a Node model for it.
        Parameters:
        pEq - The String representation of the equation. Is only ever used to identify individual equations.
        pN - The Node that the entire equation is based off of.
        pFactors - The Factors instance for the equation.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws NotDefinedException,
                        TypeMisMatchException
        Note that if this is going to be called from the commandline, the syntax is as follows: java Equation (-v v1:val v2:val) (-f f1:val f2:val) "equation"
        Parameters:
        args - The arguments to pass. See description of this method for details.
        Throws:
        NotDefinedException
        TypeMisMatchException

      • genNode

        public void genNode()
        Generates node using equation.

      • genNode

        public void genNode(java.lang.String pEq)
        Generates node using pEq.
        Parameters:
        pEq - The equation that this class's node will be based off of.

      • eval

        public static double eval(Factors pFactors,
                          Node pNode)
                   throws NotDefinedException
        Evaluates pNode using pFactors.
        Parameters:
        pFactors - The factors (variable values and function definitions) that will be used to evaluate pNode.
        pNode - The node that will be evaluated using pFactors.
        Returns:
        A numerical representation of pNode, when evaluated using pFactors.
        Throws:
        NotDefinedException - Thrown if either a variable or a function wasn't defined.
        See Also:
        Factors.eval(Node)

      • eval

        public static double eval(Factors pFactors,
                          Node pNode,
                          java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> pVars)
                   throws NotDefinedException
        Evaluates pNode using pFactors and pVars.
        Parameters:
        pFactors - The factors (variable values and function definitions) that will be used to evaluate pNode.
        pNode - The node that will be evaluated using pFactors.
        pVars - Used instead of pFactors's vars if a conflict between the two arises.
        Returns:
        A numerical representation of pNode, when evaluated using pFactors, and pVars.
        Throws:
        NotDefinedException - Thrown if either a variable or a function wans't defined.
        See Also:
        Factors.eval(Node, HashMap)

      • eval

        public double eval()
            throws NotDefinedException
        Evaluates node using factors.
        Returns:
        A numerical representation of node, when evaluated using factors.
        Throws:
        NotDefinedException - Thrown if either a variable or a function wasn't defined.
        See Also:
        eval(Factors, Node)

      • eval

        public double eval(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Double> pVars)
            throws NotDefinedException
        Evaluates node using factors and pVars.
        Parameters:
        pVars - Used instead of factors's vars if a conflict between the two arises.
        Returns:
        A numerical representation of node, when evaluated using factors and pVars.
        Throws:
        NotDefinedException - Thrown if either a variable or a function wasn't defined.
        See Also:
        eval(Factors, Node, HashMap)

      • fixEquation

        public static java.lang.String fixEquation(java.lang.String eq)
        Fixes any terms that might be misleading to the compiler. For example, sinx will become sin(x). Note: To not have it do any fixing, put a "@" at the beginning of the input String
        Parameters:
        eq - The equation to be corrected.
        Returns:
        A corrected version of the equation.

      • parseTokens

        public static java.util.ArrayList<Token> parseTokens(java.lang.String rEq)
                                              throws TypeMisMatchException
        Generates an ArrayList of tokens that represent rEq. Note that this removes all whitespace (including spaces) before handling the equation.
        Parameters:
        rEq - The equation to be parsed.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of tokens, each representing a different chunk of the equation.
        Throws:
        TypeMisMatchException
        See Also:
        Token

      • isAlphaNumPQ

        public static boolean isAlphaNumPQ(char c)
        Checks if a character is alphanumeric, period, or a single quote (').
        Parameters:
        c - The character to test.
        Returns:
        True if the character is alphanumeric, period, or a single quote ('). False otherwise.

        Checks if a character is alphanumeric or a period.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        True if the character is alphanumeric or a period. False otherwise.

        public static boolean isAlphaNumP(java.lang.String str)
        Checks if a String consists only of letters, digits, and / or periods.
        Parameters:
        str - The String to test.
        Returns:
        True if the String consists only of letters, digits, and / or periods. False otherwise.

        Checks if a String consists only of letters.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • isNumP

        public static boolean isNumP(char c)
        Checks if a character is a digit or period.
        Parameters:
        c - The character to test.
        Returns:
        True if the character is a digit or period. False otherwise.

      • isNumP

        public static boolean isNumP(java.lang.String str)
        Checks if a String consists only of digits and / or periods. Please note that this doesn't check to make sure there _are_ digits. So "...." will return true.
        Parameters:
        str - The String to test.
        Returns:
        True if the String is only digits and / or periods. False otherwise.

      • toFullString

        public java.lang.String toFullString()
        Gives a String representation of this equation. Comprised of equation, factors, and node.
        Returns:
        A String representation of this equation.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Just returns equation.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A basic String representation of this equation.

      • toFancyString

        public java.lang.String toFancyString()
        Gives a pretty-looking representation of this equation. comprised of equation, and factors' Factors.vars and Factors.funcs.
        Returns:
        A fancy String representation of this equation.
